body: Energy prices have gone on a wild ride lately, roiling consumers and industry alike. Even before temperatures turned wintry, the cost of heating oil spiked upward and then retreated. And strong demand has sent diesel fuel soaring far more than at similar points in the past. Mysterious as this volatility seems, it has a simple explanation. The oil
title: Refiners Gamble on Low Inventories, Insuring Volatility

body: New York City will make its first major service cut in recycling next month when it scales back collections for half the city's households. The reduction -- from weekly to alternate week pickups -- is the first tangible effect of Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's $26 million cut to the city's recycling budget. The change is to begin Sept. 9. The Mayor
title: New Yorkers Face 2 Weeks of Storing Trash for Recycling
